title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 7 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: man jailed for causing fatal crash near newport .
police get more 999 calls than on new year 's eve .

documents.title: man in 60s beaten and robbed in shrewsbury
text: a man in his 60s has been beaten up and robbed in shrewsbury .
police say he was walking along a footpath on telford way at around 22:30 yesterday , when he was knocked to the ground .
his attacker , who was wearing dark clothing , then continued to beat him , causing injuries to his arms , legs and face , before taking jewellery and escaping on a mountain bike .

documents.title: appeal for new garden at hospital off to quick start
text: an appeal to raise £ 675,000 to help build a special garden for spinal patients at the orthopaedic hospital at gobowen is off to a good start and has already collected £ 126,000 .
the hospital has joined forces with the charity horatio 's garden to create the new space and will be employing bunny guinness from the bbc 's gardener 's question time to create it .
the area will be divided up into five different spaces and mr guinnness said it would be `` the most beautiful sanctuary , which will be here for years to come to enhance the stay of patients . ''
it 's hoped that work will start in autumn 2018 .

documents.title: wine producers enjoyed record 2016
text: english wine producers toasted record-breaking sales in 2016 , a new study shows .
winemakers generated £ 132m last year - up 16 % on 2015 - while a record 64 new producers obtained licences to produce wine , according to the analysis by funding options .
martin millington from the shropshire winemaker wroxeter roman vineyard said he 'd seen english wines gradually gain more of a foothold since he started 26 years ago .

he said that when he started there were fewer than 100 vineyards in this country and getting planning permission to set one up on green fields was very difficult , because the authorities classed wine-making as an industrial activity .
mr millington successfully challenged that designation and says it is a lot easier to set up a vineyard these days .

documents.title: man jailed for mother and partner attack
text: man jailed for mother and partner attack

documents.title: tractor rally raises over £ 2,000 for hos
text: a tractor rally at melverley yesterday has raised over £ 2,000 for severn hos
the annual event attracted 112 machines , some of them used by farmers , others restored by enthusiasts .
author: Sean Fogarty
Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : two more defencemen added to tigers squad
text: telford tigers have added another two players to their squad for the new nihl season - defencemen jordan stokes and dale white .
stokes played four times for coventry blaze in the elite league last season and the 18-year-old was with hull pirates before that .
white is 27 and played 54 games for tigers in the 2014-15 epl season - he has played over 100 elite league games for the blaze .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: roof tiles called out after roof tiles fall on pavement
text: firefighters were called out to a property in the old coleham area of shrewsbury yesterday evening , because roof tiles had come loose and were falling on to the pavement below .

documents.title: bridge closed for repairs
text: the fitz bridge , which carries the road from montford bridge to leaton over the river perry is going to be closed for two days .
repair work started at 09:30 this morning and traffic is being diverted via grafton and walford heath .

documents.title: bomere heath man jailed for attack on girlfriend and mother
text: a bomere heath man been given an eight year sentence at stafford crown court for stabbing his partner and hitting his mother with a baseball bat .
wayne williams , who is 54 , pleaded guilty last month to the attempted murder of his girlfriend , and wounding with intent to do grievous bodily harm to his 86-year-old mother .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: more than £ 11m to be spent on rural broadband
text: more than £ 11m is going to be spent to set up wireless broadband in rural parts of shropshire .
shropshire council says the work will take three years and the new transmitters will eventually reach 14,000 premises .

worcester-based airband community internet has been employed to carry out the work , with nearly half of the £ 11.2m coming from the government 's bduk project and the rest coming from airband , the marches local enterprise partnership and the council , which is contributing £ 2.4m .

documents.title: craven arms lorry driver gets 21-year ban over false records
text: a lorry driver from shropshire has been banned from professional driving for 21 years after helping a colleague falsify records .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: 'england 's longest ' diversion over
text: a near 60-mile traffic diversion on the a49 has ended as network rail completed work on the onibury railway crossing .
the work was due to take 10 days , but has been completed a day early - much to the relief of businesses and residents in south shropshire .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright and clear start it will become cloudier with the chance of some showers this afternoon and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: protests over maternity unit closures
text: protests over maternity unit closures

documents.title: remembering the women of war
text: remembering the women of war

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather on monday .

documents.title: hot weather causes a range of extra 999 calls
text: the police say calls about anti-social behaviour , noisy neighbours , dogs stuck in cars and people playing in dangerous water make up the bulk of their extra calls in hot weather .
the warwickshire and west mercia forces say they took more 999 calls this morning than on new years eve and believe the hot weather is the cause .
and the call-handlers say that when it 's warm alcohol is quite often cause anti-social behaviour and disputes between neighbours .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a cloudy weekend ahead
text: it 's going to be cloudy and a little cooler over the weekend , with the chance of a few showers .
temperatures should reach 23c ( 74f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : 'strawnado ' filmed in shropshire
text: this mini-whirlwind was spotted near minsterley this week and because it 's tossing straw up into the air it 's being called a `` straw-nado '' .
it was filmed by ceri littler who said she had seen smaller whirlwinds in the past , but `` nothing like this '' and she added `` it was an amazing sight .
very lucky to have seen it ! ''
she said earlier there had been a larger one which moved over her office covering it , and the people who had gone outside to watch it , in hay .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: jail for man who caused fatal crash
text: a man from dudley has been jailed for two years after pleading guilty to causing a fatal crash on the a41 near newport in shropshire .

the crown prosecution service said mark ward , 30 , from pardarn close had been the driver of a mini cooper which collided head-on with a toyota yaris driven by mohammed lachu miah from the west midlands on 24 january 2016 .
mr miah died at the scene and three passengers in his car needed hospital treatment for their injuries .

documents.title: shropshire football pays tribute to young fan bradley lowery
text: shropshire football has been paying its tributes to bradley lowery , the young sunderland fan who has lost his long fight with cancer .
bradley became the club 's mascot and `` best mates '' with his hero , striker jermain defoe .
he also led england out at wembley for a world cup qualifier against lithuania .
all our thoughts at afc telford united are with the family of @ twitterid at this difficult time .
rest in peace little man # bradleylowery
the thoughts and prayers of the welsh champions are with the family of bradley lowery today

documents.title: your photos : overcast in badger and ludlow
text: we 're not getting the hot end to the week we 'd been forecast and we 're seeing plenty of cloud in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near badger ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cricket : former india test batsman entertains crowds in wellington
text: the former indian test batsman wasim jaffer scored a century in front of a crowd of over 700 at wrekin college in shropshire cricket club 's annual hospitality event .
he was playing for an international xi in two 20-over matches against a shropshire team and his 123 in the first game came off just 54 balls , with nine fours and nine sixes .
the match was raising money for a number of charities , including macmillan cancer support .

documents.title: shropshire tourists to benefit from free welsh buses
text: going for a weekend break into wales is going to get easier with the welsh assembly funding free buses across the country , starting tomorrow .
it will apply to all trawscymru buses and will be operating every weekend until may 2018 .
the assembly has set aside £ 1m to fund the services , saying it 's to boost visitor numbers to the country .
i hope to see this scheme provide the perfect excuse for people from across wales and beyond to jump on the bus and spend their weekends enjoying the diverse beauty of wales . ''

documents.title: your photos : cloud gathering over telford and longnor
text: that blue sky has vanished quickly and been replaced by thick cloud .
these photos have been taken this lunchtime in telford ( top ) and longnor ( below ) by bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : first match for new telford boss
text: afc telford united kick off their pre-season friendlies with a match against haughmond fc tomorrow .
their opponents were promoted last season after winning the west midlands regional league premier division .
it will be the first game in charge for new telford manager rob edwards ( above ) and the match is being played at wellington amateurs ' ground .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: volunteers wanted for wem clean-up
text: volunteers are wanted for a `` community clean-up day '' in wem tomorrow .
it 's being organised by the team wem group and is being carried out to get the town ready for the annual sweet pea show the following weekend .
the litter starts at 09:00 and will be focusing on drawwell walk , the footpath from the co-op to the footbridge , aston street , and the library .

documents.title: hot weather causing high number of 999 calls
text: there have been more 999 calls to west mercia and warwickshire police this morning than there were on new year 's eve .
the forces say they 've also received almost double the number of calls to their 101 non-emergency number and that they often see spikes like this in hot weather .
they 're urging people only to call 999 in a genuine emergency .

documents.title: 'confusing ' m54 junction road signs at shifnal to change
text: signs leading up to a newly extended island will be changed , it has been revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: hundreds of competitions at newport show
text: the great british bake off winner candice brown , a team of bagpipers and a mountain bike display team will be among the attractions at the newport show this weekend .
the event has a greater emphasis on food and drink these days , but has kept its livestock competitions , with over 100 classes of cattle and sheep on show .
and there are also competitions for plant growers and horse-riders .
in total , there are more than 600 competitions taking place and dogs which win the top prizes at newport are automatically entered into next year 's crufts .

documents.title: speed cameras in welshampton after concerns raised
text: mobile speed cameras are going to be used on the a495 at welshampton after tests found more than 40 % of drivers were exceeding the 30mph speed limit there .
the west mercia safer roads partnership collected the data after being contacted by concerned local residents and says it hopes the presence of a speed camera will slow drivers down .
the cameras will start appearing from next week .

documents.title: shotguns stolen from home
text: two shotguns have been stolen from a house in claverley .
police say the thieves broke in some time yesterday and also took a tv and jewellery among other items .
last month five shotguns were stolen from a house in kinlet .

documents.title: football : walsall and coventry paired with shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town wo n't have so far to travel in the regional first round of this year 's checkatrade trophy - after last season 's much-criticised draw took them to scunthorpe and middlesbrough .
they have been paired with walsall , coventry and an as-yet un-named premier league or championship club 's under-23 side .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : a bright start to the day in church stretton and ludlow
text: we 've had another bright start to the day , as you can see in these photos shared by bbc weather watchers in church stretton ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'beach party ' in snailbeach
text: the village of snailbeach is hosting a `` beach party '' this weekend , which will include tours of the local lead mine , talks and a flower festival .
and the area has been decorated with a number of unusual scarecrows , like the ones here .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football fan travelling 8,500 miles to watch game in whitchurch
text: an altrincham fan is travelling 8,500 miles to watch a match at whitchurch alport on saturday .
mark buckton is flying over from taiwan with his wife ching yeh and said he arranged the two-week visit with the pre-season friendly in mind .
it 's the first time he 's been back to the country in nine years and he said he wanted to take his wife on a tour of england and north wales too .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: work gets under way on lidl at shrewsbury town 's ground
text: work has started on budget supermarket lidl 's second shrewsbury store which is set to open early next year .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cliff railway celebrates 125 years
text: bridgnorth cliff railway is celebrating 125 years since it opened on this day in 1892 .
the funicular railway used to be powered by a water tank but now runs on electricity .
it was originally built to help get people from bridgnorth 's high town to low town .
originally the carriage at the top would have a tank full of water making it heavier than the carriage that was about to ascend .
after it had descended , pulling up the other carriage , the process would be repeated .

documents.title: village knitted poppies to go on display
text: the village of loppington , near wem , is putting together a flower festival that will feature a cascade of knitted poppies .
the poppies have been knitted by volunteers from as far as solihull and wales .
during the past week , volunteers have fastened the poppies to a backing in preparation for hanging them from the outside of the church tower .
the festival is called a year in the life of a village church and the display will be hung outside the st michaels and all angels church tower all weekend .

documents.title: doubts over money for hospitals changes
text: the labour leader of telford & wrekin council says he 's not certain the money to make changes to shropshire 's hospitals is available .
for several years health bosses have been looking at reorganising the county 's two acute hospitals , so that one becomes a centre for planned care and the other looks after emergency cases .
councillor shaun davies says it 's an expensive process and there are no gurantees over funding .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: corvedale chicken shed houses given the go-ahead
text: a new housing estate in rural shropshire has been given the go-ahead despite objections from locals who say it will change the nature of their historic hamlet .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: crackdown on benefit cheats
text: telford and wrekin council has launched a campaign to tackle benefit cheats .
the authority needs to find another £ 21m in budget savings by 2020 and wants to stop dishonest claimants who it says are `` depriving vulnerable neighbours '' .
the council is reminding people that those who are secretly working , or claiming benefits from an address they do n't live at , could be committing fraud .
telford & wrekin council says this is money that could be spent elsewhere .
they have already made £ 109m in savings .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: cloudier than yesterday and feeling fresher , with the possibility of some showers later and highs of 24c ( 75f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
you can comment on our stories and share you by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : tns expect capacity crowd for champions league game
text: the new saints resume their champions league qualifying campaign next week , away to the croatian champions hnk rijeka .
following that , on tuesday 18 july they 'll be playing the home leg at park hall stadium and they say they expect a capacity crowd of just over 1,000 .
the ground can hold more people , but uefa regulations mean only the main stand can be used for european games .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: residents speak out after cars destroyed in arson attacks on telford streets
text: two cars have been set alight by arsonists on two residential streets in telford during the early hours of the morning .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : some thundery showers this evening
text: it 's been a hot day , with temperatures up to 27c ( 81f ) in places , but there could be some thundery showers in easterly parts of the west midlands this evening .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: university offers accommodation safety reassurance
text: the university of wolverhampton says it has carried out fresh checks on its accommodation in wolverhampton , telford and walsall , following the grenfell tower fire - and it says all of them are safe .

it said earlier this week , private company liberty living , which owns and manages the liberty living complex in wolverhampton , moved around 70 students to alternative accommodation as a precautionary measure while it carried out further safety checks on one of its blocks .
it says it is talking to all private accommodation providers it works with to get safety assurances from them .

documents.title: council asks for help tracing fly-tippers
text: fly-tippers have dumped a load of branches and aggregate bags near priorslee lake .
telford and wrekin council is asking for help in finding out where it came from .
they 're asking if anyone in the area has had their trees cut or driveway laid recently .

documents.title: your photos : boats and tractors in the sunshine
text: we 're continuing to get some great photos of shropshire shared with us this afternoon .
these ones were taken near market drayton ( top ) and longnor ( below ) by bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: thunderstorms expected to miss shropshire
text: there have been warnings from the met office that we could get some thundery showers in shropshire this evening , but it now appears they will largely pass us by .
there could be some light showers early on , but most of the county will stay sunny .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fresh crackdown on mobile phones while driving
text: police in west mercia and warwickshire are preparing to launch another crackdown on people using mobile phones while driving .
earlier this year the fines and penalties for getting caught doubled to £ 200 and six penalty points on your driving licence .
police are also reminding people it is illegal to use your phone to follow a map , read a text or check social media , even if you are stopped at the lights or in traffic .
with smartphones becoming more and more embedded into our daily routines , we are all aware of how useful they can be .
however , it is unacceptable to allow yourself to be distracted by them while driving , and officers will ensure any motorists doing so face the penalties involved . ''

documents.title: cricket : sandhu fails to take wickets for derbyshire
text: gurjit sandhu 's attempts to earn a contract with derbyshire have n't got off to the best start after taking just three wickets in the match against durham at chesterfield .
the left-armer , who has been playing for shropshire , was used for only seven overs of durham 's second innings and did n't add to the three he took in their first innings .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: inspections on shrewsbury church stonework
text: a shrewsbury church which has recently had major restoration work is going to get another inspection , to see if more needs to be done .
workers will be climbing st alkmunds with the help of ropes and ladders to inspect the stonework .

documents.title: fans representative says 'unrealistic ' to expect all fans to sit
text: the former chairman of the shrewsbury town supporters parliament says it is `` unrealistic '' to expect all fans to sit at football matches .
mike davis is one of a number of fans pushing forward plans to install a section of rail seating at the club 's otley road stadium .
the club has made an application to get around 500 seats installed in the salop leisure stand and is asking fans to help fund it .
i think it 's unrealistic to say and to enforce the fact that everyone has to sit down at football .
you just ca n't do it . ''
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: decriminalising homosexuality 50 years ago a 'brave ' move
text: a gay couple from shropshire have been talking about the impact the 1967 sexual offences act has had on their lives .
the change in the law decriminilised homosexuality and peter roscoe and geoff hardy agreed to tell their story in a short video for the uk parliament website .
peter called the act of parliament a `` tremendously brave opening '' and said being gay had been very difficult when they were younger .
the couple recalled one incident when they had a hotel booking cancelled because they were gay and geoff said when they were growing up there were `` no signs of gay life anywhere '' .

documents.title: watch : shrewsbury man gets leg signed by nadal
text: rafael nadal got a surprise at wimbledon yesterday when a man handed him a prosthetic leg to sign .
it belonged to kevin drake from shrewsbury , who is a wheelchair tennis player who has competed at the invictus games .
and that was n't the only autograph he collected .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in tibberton and market drayton
text: shropshire is enjoying some warm sunshine today and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing photos from all around the county .
these ones were taken near tibberton ( top ) and market drayton ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hospitals debate not about shrewsbury vs telford says council leader
text: the debate over the future of shropshire 's hospitals should n't be `` simplified down '' to shrewsbury versus telford , the leader of telford and wrekin council has told a bbc phone-in .

councillor shaun davies said his authority had `` never tried to make it a shrewsbury versus telford issue '' and that there would be people in the shropshire local authority area who would probably prefer to see services remain at the princess royal hospital .

the labour councillor repeated his criticism of what he described as the `` flawed '' process which led to the recommendation to downgrade telford 's a & e and move specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury .
he said nhs leaders had failed to take the public with them and that there was no guarantee that the money will be available to make the changes .

my job as the council leader is to ensure that there is fairness and also that views of telford and wrekin residents and as it happens people who live in shropshire council area as well are listened to on this important issue . ''

documents.title: drug smuggling arrests up at shropshire 's stoke heath prison
text: the number of people arrested for smuggling drugs or attempting to smuggle drugs into shropshire 's only prison is on the increase , latest figures show .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: labour council leader wants to work with conservative mps
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council says he wants to work with the two conservative mps who share his authority area `` for the betterment of the borough '' .

speaking about their relationship , councillor shaun davies said `` everybody will say they 've learned over the last few years '' and said the wrekin mp mark pritchard had worked with the council `` particularly well '' , especially on the issue of the princess royal hospital .

mr davies conceded the relationship with telford mp lucy allan `` has n't been as positive '' , but said he hoped there would be opportunities for them to work together between now and the next general election .

documents.title: telford to get pop-up beach
text: a pop-up beach is being set up in telford 's southwater development .
with a beach bar , a barbecue and deckchairs .
it will open in time for the carnival of giants on 15 july and will remain there for 10 days .

documents.title: market drayton 10k places go in record time
text: entries to market drayton 's 10k run sold out within seven hours of going on sale - despite the online entry system crashing due to high demand .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: council leader calls for fresh general election
text: the majority of people do n't want a minority conservative government and would prefer another general election , the leader of telford and wrekin council has said .
speaking on bbc radio shropshire , councillor shaun davies said the prime minister had n't got a mandate to govern .
mr davies also said the election campaign had been rushed for labour in telford , because `` it was called on the prime minister 's timetable '' .
but despite the defeat of their two local candidates , he thought the party had been `` fantastic '' and he said there had been a `` massive surge of members '' .
what i think we do need now is a new general election in order to ask the british public again whether or not they do want a minority conservative government , because i think most people do n't . ''

documents.title: 80s nightclub to open in oakengates
text: a nightclub in oakengates that was shut down by telford & wrekin council is to be replaced by new one .
the licence for the industry venue was revoked by the authority earlier this year after repeated complaints about anti-social behaviour .
the owners dropped their appeal in may .
now new operators will open a new 80s club called decades in the same building .
it will be aimed at an older age group than its predecessor .

documents.title: tennis : wheelchair tennis player gets leg signed by nadal
text: shrewsbury wheelchair tennis player kevin drake surprised rafael nadal with an unusual request yesterday - asking him to sign his artificial leg .
afterwards nadal said told reporters it was `` probably not '' the weirdest thing he had ever been asked to autograph .
not your everyday request # wimbledon
cosa bonita , cosa hermosa
ah pero como estamos hoy jaja
jajajajajajajaja ese monito es lo masss
jajaja maal , igual no le gana a tu foto de perfil
jajajajajajaja me alegraste la mañana ! !
that was awesome signing that prosthetic leg .
i bet you were a little surprised though .
it was very kind of you .
you are wonderful !
rafa nadal : leg end .
@ twitterid u beauty , one in the whole world
anything to do with you ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # whenyouthinkyouveseeneverything
super
that 's why he 's a champ
my all time fav
ah .
love rafa !
author: Elaine Muir
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : shropshire bowler looks to shine for derbyshire
text: while shropshire were beating oxfordshire , their left-arm bowler gurjit sandhu has been in action for derbyshire today , hoping a good performance can help resurrect his first-class career .
the former middlesex player got the call-up before the oxfordshire game and shared a last wicket stand of 102 with billy godleman , before taking three durham wickets .
today is the final day of the county championship match and shropshire coach karl krikken has wished him the best of luck and said he hopes he wins a contract with derbyshire .
he may get a contract now which would be great for the lad .
that 's what we 're all about at minor counties , trying to produce cricketers and we 've had a few go back into the first-class game . ''

documents.title: telford council leader in the hot seat
text: telford and wrekin council leader shaun davies is live on bbc radio shropshire at the moment , facing questions from people across the county .
you can follow the conversation and see what people are talking about on telford and wrekin 's facebook live stream .

documents.title: wellington job centre closure
text: wellington job centre is to close to save money .
services will be transferred four miles away to telford - it is unclear if any jobs will be cut .
the department for work and pensions carried out a consultation in the winter and has concluded the extra travel distances did not warrant keeping it open .

documents.title: near 60-mile detour affects ludlow trade
text: businesses in south shropshire say they 've noticed a difference while the a49 's been closed at onibury this week .
network rail is carrying out work on the level crossing there - and staff at ludlow castle say their tea-room takings are down as a result .
the official diversion is almost 60 miles long .
the ludlow food centre says it 's still too early to know the full impact of the closure .
they say they are frustrated that the 10-day closure covers two weekends when a slight shift would have only covered one .
network rail says the work is essential to improve the carriageway and track and prevent further temporary closures .

documents.title: shropshire care home shamed in national report
text: a shropshire care home has been shamed by the care quality commission as an example of poor care .
inspectors visiting meadowbrook care home in gobowen found a soiled mattress and ants crawling on a dining table .
it 's been rated as `` inadequate '' and has a year to improve or face closure .
it is among more than a third of england 's nursing homes failing on safety , according to the watchdog .
in a statement , meadowbrook care home said it was sorry it had `` fallen well below the standards that we expect all of our homes to provide '' .
`` since the inspection we have been treating this as a priority and carrying out a comprehensive programme of improvements , '' it said .

documents.title: weather warning for rain issued
text: the met office say isolated thunderstorms today could bring intense downpours , bringing the threat of sudden flooding of roads and homes .
heavy rainfall is likely to be isolated though , with many places staying dry .
yellow warning of rain for west midlands
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: jailed : telford child rapist gets 17 years
text: a child rapist telford man has been jailed for a total of 17 years for sexual offences against children .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: nursey complains about ofsted report
text: a nursery in shrewsbury has lodged an official complaint with ofsted after a recent inspection left staff in tears .
twyford tots had previously been rated `` good '' but is now `` inadequate '' .

the nursery was visited by ofsted in may , and a number of issues were brought up including safeguarding practices and the fact that the nappy changing room was in full view of visitors and other children .

in a letter to parents , the nursery states that it disagrees with the outcome of the report , saying that the inspection had to be stopped after an hour due to the conduct of one of the two inspectors .
they say that the inspection and report is not a true reflection of twyford tots and are fighting to restore their name .
the outcome of the complaint is expected by the end of the month .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a warm and bright start to the day there 's the chance of thunderstorms which could bring heavy downpours .
in between any rain will feel very warm in the sunshine with highs of 28c ( 82f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook and twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: carpet company sold for undisclosed sum
text: carpet company sold for undisclosed sum

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: telford summariser 'close to tears ' over york fixture
text: a trip to york in early august will be the ideal way for many telford fans to start the new season , especially if you have a family , but spare a thought for our afc telford united summariser steve humbles .

he 's not missed a game , home or away , for three years and when york were relegated to the national north last season the trip to north yorkshire was high on his list of priorities - he says he loves the city and goes back regularly .
unfortunately steve is due to be the best man at a wedding that day , so unless the bride and groom are feeling especially generous he will have to miss the game .
he even called it last night , before the fixtures were announced , saying he would cry if york away was the first game for the bucks .

documents.title: your photos : bees enjoying the sunshine
text: maybe there 's a lot of pollen around , because we 're seeing lots of photos of bees from the bbc weather watchers today .
these photos were taken near bicton ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: good news for fish as weeds flourish
text: have you noticed the rivers are greener than normal at the moment ?

weeds have been flourishing in the warm weather and the environment agency says because we 've not had major floods for a number of years , they 've become more established in rivers like the severn .
and it says that while this is annoying some anglers , it 's good news for young fish , who are able to find shelter and food .

documents.title: weather : the west midlands forecast for tonight and tomorrow
text: after a sunny day for most of us , here 's how your night is looking along with tomorrow morning .
you can also get the latest forecasts for your part of the west midlands via the bbc weather website .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: telford man jailed for raping girls
text: a 25-year-old telford man who raped three girls and sexually assaulted another has been jailed for 18 years .
nicholas gallantree was found guilty of three counts of rape and one of sexual assault at shrewsbury crown court and will be on the sex offenders register for life .
west mercia police said gallantree `` groomed , intimidated and abused his victims , telling them not to trust people in authority '' .

all four victims suffered abhorrent abuse and were incredibly brave in coming forward to tell police what had happened to them , i hope the sentence handed to him allows them to move on with their lives . ''

documents.title: football : victorious tns players return home
text: the victorious new saints players are back in the uk after their visit to portugal .
they were playing their champions league qualifier at a stadium near faro , because the europa fc stadium in gibraltar was n't up to uefa specifications .
departing faro and arrival at manchester .
lots of delays but we took it all in our stride .

documents.title: breakingcarpet firm bought by private equity company
text: brintons , the kidderminster-based carpet company , has been bought by a private equity company .
the carlyle group says it has sold the company to argand partners , which is based in new york and san francisco , for `` an undisclosed sum '' .
brintons , which also has a factory in telford , recently announced that 60 jobs were to go at its kidderminster plant .
argand partners said it was attracted by `` brintons ' leading market position '' and its `` long history of selling award-winning carpets '' .
to find such qualities in an iconic brand like brintons was rare .
supported by our investment and growth strategies we look forward to partnering with the brintons ' management team to build an even stronger business in the future . ''

documents.title: work starts on shrewsbury lidl store
text: work has started on a new lidl store next to shrewsbury town 's stadium .

the football club had struggled to get planning permission , because it involves building on land earmarked for community use , but it was successful on its third attempt after offering up one of its training pitches as a replacement .
and it promised money to pay for sports provision in the county .

documents.title: nutrients in rivers causing algae growth
text: the environment agency says high levels of nutrients in shropshire 's rivers is causing problems for fish at the moment .
their local rivers specialist chris bainger says they 're seeing lots of algae growing as a result and this is leading to high oxygen levels .
this in turn is upsetting the fish because food is hidden by the algae and they are distressed by the extra oxygen .
he says it 's not a major problem , but the agency is working with farmers to reduce run-off from fields .
the low clear running river # clun today looks pristine but the smothering of diatoms indicate excessive nutrients are present @ twitterid

documents.title: delayed roadworks to start next week
text: roadworks on the a458 bridgnorth bypass will start next tuesday .
they were delayed to avoid a clash with work on the onibury level crossing on the a41 , which is sending diverted traffic down the a458 .
the bridgnorth work will start on the river severn bridge and on the stourbridge road and kidderminster road roundabouts .
it will mean temporary traffic lights being set up and workers are due to remain on site until 10 november .

documents.title: maternity unit closure 'putting lives at risk '
text: a shropshire councillor says she is `` mortified '' by a potential six-month closure of oswestry 's maternity unit and believes it is putting lives at risk .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: some car parks would be cheaper under proposals
text: while a proposed shake-up of car parking charges by shropshire council is causing some anger , because of price rises in some areas , staying in other car parks could become cheaper .
for instance it costs £ 1.20 to park for up to an hour at the frankwell car park in shrewsbury at the moment and that would drop to 70p under the plans .
and staying in the town 's abbey foregate car park for up to an hour would cost 50p , rather than the current £ 1.10 .
there would also be 34 car parks around the county charging less than £ 1 an hour and 14 car parks would be free .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : the new saints 'under no illusions ' about croatian match
text: the new saints will face croatian side hnk rijeka in the second qualifying round of the champions league and manager scott ruscoe says he is `` under no illusions '' about the strength of their opposition .

they won the croatian first division ahead of big names like dinamo zagreb and hajduk split and ruscoe said `` croatian football is a very good standard '' , pointing to the success of their national team .
the tns manager said he would be flying out to croatia to watch their opponents play and said his side would have to be at their best to get through to the next round .

documents.title: concern about limits to routine operations
text: vital nhs operations and treatments are being increasingly rationed in england , leaving patients in pain , according to a study by the british medical journal
the treatments affected include hip and knee replacements and cataract surgery to help restore sight as well as drugs for conditions such as arthritis .
shropshire 's health commissioners changed their guidelines in 2015 , to limit some operations to those people who were in the most severe need .

it said the move had been made `` to make sure the right people get the right operation at the right time '' , but opponents said the move was leaving patients in pain and creating `` barriers to care '' .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers re-sign experienced forward
text: telford tigers have re-signed experienced forward adam taylor for the new nihl season .
the 23-year-old has been with the team since the age of 15 , having progressed through the youth system , and has played over 250 epl games .
he was involved in two league-title-winning sides for the tigers and head coach tom watkins described him as an `` underrated player '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: west midlands mep in party leadership bid
text: a west midlands mep has announced he is standing to become the next leader of ukip .
bill etheridge has called himself the party 's `` libertarian candidate '' , and is aiming to succeed paul nuttall , who quit as leader after poor results in the general election .
the deadline for candidates is the end of july , with former leader nigel farage ruling himself out .

documents.title: football : telford away to york on first day of season
text: afc telford united will be away to york city on the first day of the new season - 5 august .
the former football league side were relegated to telford 's division on the final day of last season .
the york game will be followed by home games against brackley and salford .
christmas and new year sees home and away derby games with kidderminster , and it all finishes at boston on 28 april .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : blue skies over hopton heath and all stretton
text: we 're forecast blue skies and plenty of sun today and we 're seeing that in the photos shared by the bbc weather watchers today .
these ones were taken near hopton heath ( top ) and all stretton ( below ) this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: your comments : anger at car parking proposals
text: plans to change car parking charges in shropshire , to introduce a new system of hourly rates , is provoking a lot of comment on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page .

the top band for on-street parking will rise from £ 1.60 an hour to £ 2.50 an hour and eleanor speed wrote : `` people will just continue to keep shopping online , because who wants to pay £ 10 for parking for a few hours shopping ?
steve cooper had a gloomy prediction .
`` in the next three years shrewsbury will be all but destroyed .
so many businesses are closing or struggling.the foot fall in the town centre is the lowest i 've ever seen it . ''

and nick cox was one of a number of people to compare shrewsbury to other towns in the midlands , writing , `` i can park in birmingham centre for £ 3 for 24 hours , people wonder why the shopping centres in shrewsbury are empty . ''

documents.title: dust off your apron for the shropshire big bake
text: it 's time to get your mixing bowls out and dust off your apron in preparation for the shropshire big bake .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: football : tns manager praises 'organised ' europa fc
text: the new saints manager scott ruscoe said his side played better before europa fc were reduced to nine men last night .

tns eventually won their champions league qualifier against the gibraltan side , but they needed extra time to get the decisive goal and ruscoe praised their opponents ' organisation , saying they were `` a credit to themselves '' .
europa fc had both gomez and rodríguez rivas sent off in the 58th minute , just five minutes after they 'd levelled the tie at 3-3 on aggregate .

documents.title: council says parking fare increases will reduce congestion
text: shropshire council says its proposed changes to car parking charges will reduce congestion and pollution in town centres by encouraging people to park elsewhere .
it wants to introduce a new range of banded parking fees , ranging from 30p an hour to £ 2.50 an hour in the most heavily used areas .

council director george candler said they wanted to extend charges in shrewsbury until 20:00 in the evening , because the `` night time economy is booming '' and the car parks were seeing increased `` wear and tear '' .
the council runs 78 car parks and says it wants to hear what people think about the proposals when they are opened up to consultation .

the car parking strategy is set out to tackle a number of things , one of which is reducing congestion in our key market times and encouraging people where they can to park on those car parks on the edge of our town centres . ''

documents.title: weather : yellow warning for rain tomorrow
text: the met office says `` two waves of thunderstorms are expected to affect the west midlands on thursday '' .
it is warning `` 20 to 30mm ( 1 - 1.2in ) of rain may fall within an hour and perhaps 50 to 80mm ( 2 - 3in ) in two or three hours '' .
yellow warning of rain for west midlands

documents.title: public opinion affected swimming pool decision
text: public anger at plans to move shrewsbury 's swimming pool out of the town centre played a part in getting the proposals reconsidered - according to the shropshire councillor responsible for leisure services .
the authority had given interested organisations until october to come up with bids to run shrewsbury 's pool and had favoured moving it to a site on the outskirts of the town .
a change of leadership at the council since may 's local elections means it has decided to put a stop to that process .

councillor lezley picton said they were going to go back to square one with `` nothing ruled out and nothing ruled in '' but said she did n't want `` organisations spending money unnecessarily '' on bidding to run the pool .
the new leader of shropshire council , peter nutting , said after his election that he wanted to see the pool remain in the town centre .
i think that public opinion has had an impact on this , but there is a real will from the current administration to see what else is out there . ''

documents.title: prisoner jailed for smuggling drugs and mobile phones into stoke heath prison
text: a prisoner who took drugs , mobile phones and sim cards to distribute has been given a further jail term .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cricket : shropshire up to second place after win
text: shropshire have risen to second place in the western division of the minor counties league , after their eight-wicket win over oxfordshire at shifnal yesterday .
it was their first win of the season , after draws with wales and herefordshire .
after bowling oxfordshire out for 196 in their second innings , shropshire were left a target of 94 to win the game and got there with the loss of omar ali and will parton .
they now head to st austell to face cornwall on 16 july .

documents.title: football : tns beat nine-man europa fc in extra time
text: the new saints recovered from their 2-1 home leg defeat to win their champions league qualifier in portugal last night .
they beat nine-man europa fc 3-1 in extra-time .
tns were 2-0 up on the champions of gibraltar at half time , but needed extra time after they were pegged back in the second half .
they will face croatian side rijeka in the next round .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: number of rough sleepers on the increase
text: government figures suggest the numbers of rough sleepers in the uk 's smaller towns and cities are continuing to increase .
official estimates show the number of people sleeping rough is up by almost a quarter in the last year including in shropshire where it 's up from 15 to 22 .
it is a figure that has been on the rise for some time .
as of autumn 2016 , there were an estimated 4,134 people a night sleeping rough in england , which was more than double the number in 2010 and a 16 % increase on the year before .

documents.title: shropshire libraries to be run by outside bodies
text: craven arms library is being held up as a beacon for what can be achieved by outsourcing the service .
shropshire council is transferring the running of all but six of its biggest libraries to outside bodies with funding to help set up the centres .
the craven arms facility is now run independently inside the town 's community and sports centre .

documents.title: shrewsbury sign goalkeeper macgillivray
text: shrewsbury sign goalkeeper macgillivray

documents.title: shrewsbury parking charges set to rise
text: there are fears that parking charge rises in shrewsbury town centre will drive people to shop in telford or retail parks instead .
shropshire council is to consult on a series of car parking changes which will see on-street town centre parking charges increase from £ 1.60 an hour to £ 2.50 .
there 'll be no time limits - and each of the council 's 78 car parks will be in one of seven different pricing bands .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man who raped three girls in telford jailed for 18 years
text: a man who raped three teenagers and assaulted a fourth , manipulating and controlling them so they feared him , has been given an 18-year extended jail sentence .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be dry today with sunny spells across the board .
with light winds , it will feel warm in the sunshine , particularly towards the south .
highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: more fines for false claims for free prescriptions
text: the number of fines for claiming free prescriptions in the county has almost doubled in the past year .
shropshire 's health commissioners say they have no power over the fines and receive none of the income from them as they are dealt with centrally .
the british medical association says the fines often hit those on low incomes and with long-term illnesses , many of whom are fined for not having renewed exemption certificates on time .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: shrewsbury mp wants government to break hospitals deadlock
text: the mp for shrewsbury has asked the government to push forward plans to reorganise shropshire 's hospitals .

there are proposals to have just one full a & e in the county in shrewsbury in the future and move specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury as well and daniel kawczynski has been keen to see the plans move ahead .

mr kawczynski said the plans could lead to hundreds of millions of pounds of investment in the local nhs and claimed that was being jeopardised by telford and wrekin council and telford clinical commissioning group which have opposed the plans .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire beat oxfordshire
text: shropshire have knocked off the 94 runs they need to beat oxfordshire and have won by eight wickets .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your comments : car parking charges unpopular
text: proposals to increase car parking charges in shrewsbury have n't gone down well on the bbc radio shropshire facebook page .
ann lewis wrote : `` that 's just ty of shrewsbury - up the parking cost .
hardly ever go now , too much to park . ''
and linda strefford was n't impressed by plans to start free parking later in the evening , writing `` to start free evening parking at 20:00 instead of 18:00 is just cruel . ''

documents.title: weather : some hot weather and storms to come
text: there 's good news and bad news .
the good news is we 're forecast a hot end to the week .
the bad news is that we could see heavy , thundery showers on thursday night .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: new walking route is complete
text: a crowd of over 200 people turned out at craven arms train station earlier , to mark the completion of a new walking route between the town and swansea .

the heart of wales line trail has been created by the the heart of wales line travellers ' association and the idea is that you can choose to walk sections , or take the train if you want to rest your feet .
author: James Bond
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: peace award for knife angel sculpture
text: shropshire 's knife angel has won a peace award at the llangollen international musical eisteddfod .
the rotary international peace award recognises an individual or organisation who has done something special to promote peace and understanding .
the other finalists were welsh refugee council , medecins sans frontiers and the tim parry jonathan ball foundation for peace .
the giant statue was built using thousands of knives surrendered to police forces around the uk .
we are honoured to have been considered for this award and overwhelmed to have won , so much has gone into creating the national monument against violence and aggression and all it stands for . ''

documents.title: cricket : shropshire chasing 94 to beat oxfordshire
text: shropshire are chasing 94 to win their minor counties match against oxfordshire .
they eventually bowled the visitors out for 196 and are currently two without loss .

documents.title: football : tns boss not concerned about hot weather
text: the tns manager scott ruscoe says his side wo n't be making any excuses about the hot weather in portugal tonight as they look to overturn a first leg deficit in their champions league qualifier .
it 's forecast to remain around 24c ( 75f ) this evening , but ruscoe pointed out the team has played in warmer conditions in countries like hungary and cyprus .

tns will need to score twice if they are going to progress and ruscoe said they might have to adapt their playing style from the first leg , to take the weather conditions into account - but he said his players were `` fit enough and strong enough '' to cope .

documents.title: telford and shrewsbury top list for new builds
text: telford and shrewsbury are among the top ten towns for new build homes in britain , it has been revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: swimming pool plans go back to the drawing board
text: plans for the future of shrewsbury 's swimming pool are back to square one , with shropshire council 's ruling conservative group saying it wants to reconsider its options .
there had been proposals to move it to a new site , possibly on the outskirts of the town .
the authority had a change in leadership after the elections in may and new leader peter nutting has said he is keen to see the pool remain in the town centre .

documents.title: car parking charges set to rise
text: parking looks set to get more expensive in shrewsbury , with shropshire council planning changes to the amount it charges .
it is proposing to put up the cost of on-street parking in the town from £ 1.60 an hour to £ 2.50 .
increasing the cost of stays in council car parks is also on the cards .
under the plans , free evening parking starts at 20:00 instead of 18:00 , with the raven meadows car park open all night .
there are also plans to put up the cost of residents ' permits - and the charges for coach and lorry parking .
the proposals go before the council 's cabinet next week .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire struggling for breakthrough
text: shropshire need a breakthrough quickly if they 're going to win their minor counties match against oxfordshire at shifnal .
they 're into the afternoon session and have taken the second new ball , but have n't taken any more wickets .
oxfordshire are currently 166-6 - a lead of 63 .

documents.title: sugary drinks removed from hospital
text: sugar-sweetened drinks are being removed from a hospital restaurant , it has announced .

the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital ( rjah ) at gobowen has made the decision after nhs england has told all hospitals that from this month sales of sugar-sweetened drinks can only make up 10 % of total drinks sales .
rjah said it wanted to go one step further by removing them all .
the hospital league of friends has agreed to do the same in its shop and vending machines will also be changed .

documents.title: bottle top table from 'penny floor ' man
text: a telford man who found fame on the internet when over 100 million people saw his video of a floor he created out of old pennies , has come up with another diy creation .
this time matt giles has put together a film showing how to decorate a table with beer bottle tops .
he uses the same principles and covers the surface in an epoxy resin to seal them in place and says it was something he has been wanting to try for ages .

documents.title: your photos : clouds over longnor
text: we 're due some sunny weather later in the week , but right now it remains cloudy in shropshire , as you can see in this photo shared by bbc weather watcher peter steggles this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: demolition to start at ironbridge power station
text: planners have ruled that uniper , which owns buildwas power station does not need prior approval to demolish conveyors 6 and 7 and accompanying conveyor tower between the national grid substation and main power station buildings at the site on buildwas road .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury to play pre-season friendly in portugal
text: the new saints are n't the only shropshire team playing in portugal today - shrewsbury town have a friendly match lined up against ebbsfleet united .
both sides are out there for warm weather training camps and this will be shrewsbury 's first pre-season game .
paul hurst 's side are due to play friendlies against aston villa , wolves , cardiff and telford when they return to the uk and travel to brackley town next tuesday .

documents.title: thieves steal safe from co-op in bridgnorth
text: thieves have broken into the co-op store on mill street in bridgnorth and taken the safe .
the police say they got in sometime between 23:00 yesterday and 02:00 this morning and also took a large quantity of cigarettes .

documents.title: cricket : frustrating morning for shropshire
text: shropshire 's cricketers have been frustrated on the final morning against oxfordshire at shifnal .
the visitors resumed this morning on 67 for 3 , still 36 runs short of shropshire after the home sides first innings 383 for 9 and they have now moved on to 130 for 5 .
that 's a lead of 27 with five second innings wickets still in hand with half an hour to go until lunch .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: syrian refugees to set up pop-up cafes
text: syrian refugees who 've been given new homes in oswestry are planning to set up pop-up cafes , to fund their driving lessons .
it 's just over a year since shropshire welcomed the first syrian refugee families to the area and formal support through the refugee action charity has now ended .
the first five families came to live in oswestry , and others followed , to live in wem and shrewsbury .

documents.title: football : fans to quiz management on future of club
text: afc telford united fans will get to learn more about the direction of the club at a fans forum tonight , after a week of changes which saw the departure of the manager and the chairman .
interim chairman andy pryce and director luke fearnall , will also be expecting questions on the involvement of wolverhampton wanderers , who have increased their investment in the club .
the new manager , former wolves coach rob edwards , will also make an appearance at the learning centre bar , after first team training has finished .

documents.title: west mercia police sick days due to stress double
text: the number of sick days through stress taken at west mercia police has doubled in six years - despite a fall in the total number of officers employed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : 'this tie is not over ' says tns manager
text: the new saints manager scott ruscoe is n't giving up on their champions league qualifier against europa fc , despite being 2-1 down from the first leg .
speaking ahead of tonight 's second leg , he said `` believe me , this tie is not over '' and that his team had gone away from home before and got results .
the game will be played in portugal and ruscoe said it would be an away game for their opponents too .
if we play our normal way of playing , our tns style of play , then it will take care of itself .
i do n't think we can play as bad again . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: virtual reality tours of new council homes
text: virtual reality tours are going to be created to show prospective tenants around new council-built homes in telford .
the authority has carried out a trial of the technology and now wants to hire a software developer to create the 3d images for 80 new houses it is putting up for rent in madeley and dawley .
the council says it hopes to use this 3d modelling for all new buildings in the future and believes it will answer a lot of questions about the properties , without needing to visit .

documents.title: teenager with serious leg injury in lea cross crash
text: a 19-year-old has suffered a serious leg injury after a crash at lea cross .
the seat he was driving collided head-on with a honda at 23:15 on the a488 last night and the driver of the honda suffered a suspected broken ankle .

documents.title: new saints travel to portugal for second leg of champion 's league
text: the new saints will be without two players for tonight 's champions league tie away to europa fc of gibraltar .
midfielder chris sargeant has a bit of whiplash after a bump in his car , while left back chris marriott is still carrying a hip injury .
europa 's stadium was not considered suitable so the teams will play at the estadio do algarve in portugal .
tns trail 2-1 from last week 's first leg in oswestry .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lottery fund chair hails 'most important building of modern age '
text: shrewsbury 's flax mill has been described as `` the most important building of the modern age '' by the chair of the heritage lottery fund , sir peter luff .
it is believed to be the world 's first iron-framed building and the former mp said `` it deserves to be much better known '' .
the building methods pioneered in the flax mill would later allow the first skyscrapers to be built and the heritage england has started a major restoration project , funded by the lottery .

documents.title: shropshire cricketers have upper hand against oxford
text: shropshire 's cricketers are taking on oxfordshire at shifnal in the final day of unicorns championship match .
the visitors will resume this morning on 67 for 3 .
they still need 36 runs to match shropshire 's first innings total of 383 for 9 .
with only today to go shropshire will need to take the seven wickets quickly .
as both sides are scoring freely they 'll need to take them cheaply .
it 's oxford 's game to loose if they ca n't hold out .

documents.title: 30th anniversary of transatlantic flight for oswestry balloonist
text: the shropshire balloon maker per lindstrand has been recalling his record-breaking flight across the atlantic with richard branson , 30 years after they made the journey .
he said it was a `` massive change of technology '' , using a pressurised capsule and flying in a jet stream using a balloon powered by solar cells .
he also said none of it was properly tested before they set off and that they worked very well as a team with mr branson relying heavily on his flying skills during the journey .
the near 5,000km ( 3,100 miles ) journey marked the first time the atlantic had been crossed in a hot air balloon .
it was not the last record to be set by lindstrand and branson .
it was a massive change of technologies .
it was the first time you 'd flown continuously in a pressurised capsule , first time flown in the jet stream and first time to use solar power to lift the balloon . ''

documents.title: family of four flee blazing house near oswestry
text: a family had to flee over fields when a fire engulfed their home near oswestry .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: telford plays host to grand final for school pupils
text: shropshire plays host today to school pupils from across the midlands for the grand final of a business competition .
called the national enterprise challenge it 's for youngsters between the ages of 11 and 15 .
the contest is backed by dragon 's den star theo paphitis and there will be 120 teams hoping to win the first prize .
it 's the brainchild of two cousins , ben and mike dyer , who grew up on an estate in stoke .
they describe themselves as fed up with seeing young people leave school unready for the world of work .
olympic champion canoeist joe clarke will be attending .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: weather : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a warm but fairly cloudy start with some drizzle possible , but brighter spells later with some sunny intervals and highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : gifts pile up for shropshire rescue dog
text: bullseye the american bull terrier has waited three years at a shropshire kennels to find a new owner , but he has got no shortage of admirers , after his details were posted on facebook .
and they 've been sending him gifts .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: boy , 16 , rescued from cliff face near oswestry
text: a teenager had to be rescued by firefighters after getting stuck on a cliff near oswestry .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : warm and humid weather on its way
text: we 're due a mild night and the weather is forecast to get warmer as the week progresses and temperatures could reach 24c ( 75f ) by thursday and friday .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: government back to school on funding
text: government back to school on funding
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: cricket : shropshire lead oxfordshire after first innings
text: shropshire have just finished their first innings on day two of their minor counties match against oxfordshire .
they scored 383-9 off their 90 overs at shifnal with omar ali and ross aucott both scoring 90 .
that 's a lead of 103 and oxfordshire have just started their second innings - they are nine without loss .

documents.title: orleton sewer project explained
text: severn trent is planning to upgrade the sewers in orleton , near richard 's castle to prevent flooding .
it is holding a drop-in session today to explain the work , which is going to cost £ 550,000 .
the village has suffered from flooding in the millbrook close area , when it gets heavy rain .

documents.title: your photos : berries and bright skies
text: there 's still some cloud around , but it 's been brighter this afternoon and we 've had a number of bbc weather watchers sharing photos of fruit on hedgerows .
these were taken near norton ( top left ) newport ( top right ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shrewsbury market hall roof-top tours return
text: members of the public will get another chance to view shrewsbury 's historic buildings and streets from on high when roof-top tours return to the town 's market hall for their fourth series .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: football : international stadium to host tns game
text: one of the stadiums built for the 2004 european championships in portugal will be the venue for tomorrow 's champions league qualifier between the new saints and europa fc .
the 30,000-capacity estadio algarve is being used because uefa says the gibraltar club 's own stadium is n't suitable for the match .
tns will go into the game 2-1 down from the first leg in oswestry .

documents.title: watch : ex-wife of dead man confident justice will be done
text: the ex-wife of a man whose remains were found by the m54 says she is confident those responsible for his death will eventually face justice .
and lavina sohl says she doubts the person or people meant to kill 37-year-old surjit takhar .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: parking machines to be converted by the end of the month
text: shropshire council says all of its car parks should be capable of accepting the new £ 1 coin by the end of the month .

a number of machines in shrewsbury , bridgnorth and much wenlock have already been converted , but the council says there is a queue of local authorities wanting to get the work done - and it accepts this can be frustrating for people .
the council says it has asked its car parking officers to be patient and allow people time to get the correct coins .

documents.title: shrewsbury town fan zone to continue
text: shrewsbury town say their `` fan zone '' will return when the new season starts in august .

it included a small stage outside the ground for live music , along with stalls selling food and drinks to supporters and the club says hundreds used it during a four-game trial at the end of last season .
shrewsbury 's head of community , jamie edwards , said it will probably have to shut over the winter months , because of the weather , but might open for a christmas event .
he is also hoping add attractions for children and is looking for seven or eight volunteers to set up a steering group , to run it .

documents.title: man in court over halfway house death
text: a 58-year-old man has appeared at stafford crown court , charged with murdering 67-year-old satnam singh blugher at halfway house last week .
his body was found at tony 's diner on monday .
belkar singh has been remanded in custody following the appearance and will be back in court on 15 september , when he will be asked to enter a plea .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire batsmen enjoy shifnal pitch
text: shropshire are closing in on oxfordshire 's first innings total in their minor counties match at shifnal .
after resuming on 71 without loss this morning , they 've moved on to 200-3 at lunch .
omar ali ( above ) was out for 90 and captain steve leech for 50 .
oxfordshire finished 280 for 7 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: work starts on montgomery canal nature reserve
text: work begins today to create a nature reserve as part of the restoration of the montgomery canal , near oswestry .
three hectares of land at aston locks , will create a new habitat for wildlife including birds , otters and water voles .
it 's part of a £ 4m project to reopen the canal .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: church mission targets telford , ludlow and bridgnorth
text: church 'missioners ' will be sent to shropshire neighbourhoods to persuade people to give god a try .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: buffy actor sends bed to rescue dog
text: the actor anthony stewart head , who starred in buffy the vampire slayer and merlin , has called a shropshire dogs home to offer a new bed to an american bull terrier .
bullseye has been at hilbrae at cold hatton for three years , waiting to be rehomed and staff there say it was the actor 's wife sarah fisher , who spotted him on their facebook page .
the kennels say they know some dogs will never find new homes , so they need to make life for them as comfortable as possible .

documents.title: motorists could help police investigating sex attack
text: police believe a motorist might have witnessed a sexual assault in stirchley a week ago and are appealing for dashboard camera footage .
the victim , a woman in her 20s , was attacked at 21:30 on 25 june on havenwood by a man wearing black gloves .
the police say the area around stirchley avenue was busy with cars at the time .

documents.title: your photos : cloud in badger and longnor
text: we 've been seeing plenty of cloud over shropshire this morning , but it appears to be clearing now .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers near badger ( top ) and longnor ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: two hurt in head-on crash
text: two people have been hurt in a head-on crash near whitchurch yesterday evening .
a yellow mg and a silver skoda collided on the a49 north of the town at 19:10 and the driver of the mg , a 60-year-old man , was taken to hospital for treatment .
the driver of the skoda , who was in his 40s , was treated for minor injuries at the scene .

documents.title: man found by motorway 'knew his killer '
text: man found by motorway 'knew his killer '

documents.title: staff pleased with £ 800k hospital eye clinic
text: staff working at the new eye clinic at the royal shrewsbury hospital say it is a big improvement on the previous ward .
a former maternity block has been converted at the cost of £ 800,000 and services transferred over last monday .

consultant ophthalmologist and clinical director prasad rao said the previous rooms were `` not fit for purpose '' and the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust said the move meant `` more clinical rooms , new equipment and extra capacity '' .
work is now being carried out to create a new paediatric ophthalmology unit in shrewsbury .
it [ the old department ] was described by most organisations as not fit for purpose .
not for eye patients , for any patients with a lot of visual impairments it was completely unsuitable . ''

documents.title: secret study on 'selling off 4,200 council homes ' in shropshire
text: experts have completed a study on selling 4,200 council homes in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers sign british u20 defenceman
text: telford tigers are continuing to build their squad and have re-signed gb under-20 defenceman corey goodison .
the 20-year-old was part of the side that won the english premier league last season .

documents.title: knife angel project awaiting peace prize decision
text: a project that 's seen a huge angel sculpture built from 100,000 knives , many handed in during police amnesties , should find out later if it 's won an international peace prize .

the save a life surrender a knife project , set up by the british ironworks centre in oswestry , has been backed by 43 police forces and is dedicated to the victims of knife crime and their families .
the winner of the rotary international peace award will be announced at the llangollen international musical eisteddfod later today .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire resume first innings
text: shropshire are resuming on 71 without loss on day two of their minor counties match against oxfordshire at shifnal
they are replying to the visitors ' first innings of 280 for 7 .
omar ali is not out 43 and steve leach 18 .

documents.title: ww2 medal ceremony veteran awarded the legion d'honneur
text: a shropshire veteran became one of a select few to be awarded the highest french decoration the legion d'honneur .
ninety-eight-year-old reginald steventon , from bomere heath , served in the kings shropshire light infantry during world war two .
he was given the award at a surprise event at the chiquito restaurant in shrewsbury in recognition of his service .
it recognised his part in the allied invasion .

documents.title: murdered man 'knew his killer ' says ex-wife
text: the ex-wife of a black country man whose body was found dumped beside the m54 motorway has told the bbc she believes his killer was someone `` close to him '' .
surjit takhar went missing from oldbury in 2008 aged 37 .
his remains were found near shifnal in shropshire seven years later .
mr takhar 's ex-wife thinks he knew his killer .
i do n't think it was done on purpose or intentionally , but something 's gone wrong somewhere .
i do n't think they meant to do it , i think it was an accident .
i honestly think there 's going to be a result at the end of this . ''
west midlands police is treating the death as murder and says it is making progress in its investigation .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: aldi dismisses suggestion of new site for whitchurch store
text: an alternative site suggested for a new out-of-town aldi supermarket has been deemed unsuitable by the firm .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shrewsbury abbey gets £ 200k grant
text: shrewsbury abbey has received a grant of more than £ 200,000 from the heritage lottery fund .
the money will be used to carry out stonework repairs and appoint a heritage officer .
the abbey is dedicated to saint peter and saint paul and was founded in 1083 as a benedictine monastery by the norman earl of shrewsbury , roger de montgomery .
the grant will also go towards the launch of a pilgrimage trail , and improve a newly designed virtual visitor experience .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather video
text: a bright day with some cloud but also some sunny spells , with the risk of some isolated showers and highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather
